item.title: Implementing a Small Interpreter in Haskell
item.description: One of my favourite assignments in my advanced functional programming course, was implementing a parser and interpreter for a subset of Python, called Boa, in Haskell. We’d just started getting a grasp of what monads are and how they work, and this project is what really solidified it for me. Here’s how we approached it and some of my reflections when looking back at it. I’ll be focusing on the interpreter, because we implemented the monad for the interpreter by hand, and I feel it’s easier to see how monads work when seeing the implementation.
